Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Marwa Elselehdar was not in charge of the Ever Given cargo ship when it got stuck in the Suez Canal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on false social media posts and altered screenshots.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Marwa Elselehdar was the captain of the Ever Given cargo ship without sufficient evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim has an alternative explanation that the ship was actually operated by a different crew and Marwa Elselehdar was not involved.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates Marwa Elselehdar's role in the incident by falsely stating that she was in charge of the ship.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting false information and not providing accurate details about the incident.
